long: Meaning: to "widen" (in any direction), i.e. (intransitively) "recede" or (transitively) "remove" (literally or figuratively, of place or relation).  Usage: (a-, be, cast, drive, get, go, keep (self), put, remove, be too, (wander), withdraw) far (away, off), loose, Ã— refrain, very, (be) a good way (off).  Source: a primitive root;
